message.content:
Neural Networks, Theory. 

Neural Networks: The paper discusses the dynamics of decision hyperplanes in a feed-forward neural network and how it relates to the adaptation process. It also explains learning deadlocks and escaping from certain local minima in the context of neural networks.

Theory: The paper presents a theoretical model of the adaptation process in neural networks using the dynamics of decision hyperplanes. It also introduces the concept of network plasticity as a dynamic property of the system and explains how hyper-plane inertia can be used to avoid destructive relearning in trained networks.
